div.p: This edition is based on Senart 1905-1906.

siddhaṃ rājñaḥ kṣaharātasya kṣatrapasya nahapānasya
jāmātrā
Senart: The reading trā is very distinct; the right side of the t however bears a slight trace of the vowel u, as if the form jāmātu had been present, along with the form jāmātrā, in the mind of the writer.
dīnīkaputreṇa uṣavadātena trigośatashasradena nadyā bārṇāsāyāṃ survarṇadānatīrthakareṇa devatābhyaḥ brāhmaṇebhyaśca ṣoḍaśagrāmadena anuvarṣaṃ varṣa brāhmaṇaśatasāhasrībhojāpayitrā
prabhāse puṇyatīrthe brāhmaṇebhyaḥ aṣṭabhāryāpradena bharukacche daśapure govardhane śorpārage ca catuśālāvasadhapratiśrayapradena ārāmataḍāga tadāga udapānakareṇa ibā-pārādā-damaṇa-tāpī-karabena-dāhanukā-nāvāpuṇyatarakareṇa etāsāṃ ca nadīnāṃ ubhatotīram sabhā
prapākareṇa
piṃḍi piṃdītakāvaḍe govardhane suvarṇamukhe śorpārage ca rāmatīrthe carakaparṣabhyaḥ
grāme grāma nānaṃgole dvātrīśatanāḷiḡeramūlasahasrapradena sahasradena govardhane triraśmiṣu parvateṣu dharmātmanā idaṃ
leṇaṃ leṇa kāritaṃ imā ca
poḍhiyo podhiyo || bhaṭārakā
aṃñātiyā
The syllable aṃ (for the anusvāra is qutie visible) has been added between kā and ñā, probably in order to point out that the initial a has been absorbed into the ā of kā. The ā of ñā is doubtful; the vowel-mark is not ordinarily, as would here be the case, placed at the top of the vertical line.
ca gato smiṃsmi
varṣāratuṃ
The u is subscribed in two ways, the one very similar to r, as here and in putrasa in the next line, the other in the shape of a small horizontal stroke, as in mocayituṃ, pitu.
mālehi
Between ye and hi there is a blank, which seems to have been filled up by two or three characters that would have been effaced. rudhaṃ utama bhādraṃ bhadraṃ mocayituṃ
te ca mālaya pranādeneva apayātā utamabhadra kānaṃ kānāṃ ca kṣatriyānaṃ sarve parigrahā kṛtā tato smiṃsmi gato pokṣarāni tatra ca mayā abhiseko kṛto
trīṇi ca tīṇi gosahasrāni datāni
